trail_desc: Large paved loop circling Busse Reservoir with shorter trail segments fanning out from the loop.
Offers riders a natural setting of gently rolling hills and breathtaking beauty as it winds through the woods.
A multi-use path that will stretch from Route 83 near Lemont to near the Indiana Border. The western segment opened in June 2015.
Straight pave trail located within the I&M Canal National Heritage Corridor, the first national park of its kind.
Paved trail runs southeast from the Old Stover Road Trailhead (across from Crabtree Nature Center) to the Paul Douglas Trail.
Vast, looping trail system makes it easy to access the preserve's diverse habitats and creates ample space for extended runs or hikes.
Follows the Des Plaines River for 22 miles in Cook County and another 31 miles north through Lake County.
Short unpaved loop on a sprawling former equestrian estate.
An extensive and vaired trail system winding through the 15,000 acre Palos Preserves.
Paved loop trail with a connection to the Crabtree Trail and Crabtree Nature Center.
Short unpaved loop that travels through woods, picnic areas and open fields.
Large paved loop circling the eastern portion of the Poplar Creek Preserves intersects with looped unpaved trails in the western portion.
A winding web of unpaved trails frequented by equestrians.
Connects multiple forest preserves, winding past lakes and wetlands, and through woodlands abundant with birds and other wildlife.

Paved loops take visitors over gently rolling hills, through prairies and forests, and alongside wetlands
and ravines.
Short paved loop at this popular Chicago preserve.
Short paved loop along the edge of the woods.
Former railroad right-of-way linking Chicago to Lansing.
Paved trail runs north from Riverdale along parks, greenways, forest preserves and Beverly Blvd to Chicago.
Short paved loop provides the perfect venue for a quick walk or run.
Perimeter loop trail provides a buffer from Orland Grassland's valuable natural areas, while showcasing the significant restoration work that has taken place there.
Loop trail following the rolling topography of the Oak Forest Heritage Preserve, highlighting the historically and ecologically significant areas.
Miles of looping and connecting unpaved trails take visitors to some of the most remote areas of Cook County.
Features a long paved trail from Brookfield Woods (outside Brookfield Zoo) to Bemis Woods.
Paved and stone trails wind through forest preserves along the North Branch of the Chicago River from the northwest side of Chicago to Lake County.
Straight paved trail located within the I&M Canal National Heritage Corridor, the first national park of its kind.
